snippet: A block in East Harlem, where a new luxury high-rise stands near a food pantry and its patrons’ apartments, illustrates the class divide Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio wants to address.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column holds that 109th St in East Harlem off Fifth Avenue, where luxury high-rise stands near food pantry and its patrons’ modest apartments, illustrates class divide Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio wants to address; says that proximity does not guarantee familiarity, and suggests that closer interactions between city's self-isolating classes may begin to address problem.
lead_paragraph: A block in East Harlem, where a new luxury high-rise stands near a food pantry and its patrons’ apartments, illustrates the class divide Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio wants to address.

headline.seo: De Blasio Could Help the Rich See the Poor Living Next Door
